Posts.Content:
First, I have never laughed so hard. What a great feeling. I love all of your posts...
I had breast cysts all my life and thought they were gone forever. Have not had one for over 15 years. I am 59 and not on hormones but I found one today. Same place as most of the painful ones that have had in the past. Right breast. Funny because the bigger ones were always aspirated from my left breast but the painful ones were always in the right breast. 
Once a doctor did a breast biopsy which burst the cyst and it quit coming back...until now anyway. 
Also, I had one female doctor in the past to ask me why I wanted it aspirated and I told her that I have a huge pain tolerance, had 2 babies back in the 80's natural (do not know what I was thinking), one weighed 9.8 lbs and the other 8.8 lbs but at least that was done and OVER. These cysts hurt 24/7 and mine have never gone away on their own. I know that aspiration is temporary fix but I do not know how anybody can stand this 24/7 pain. (She did not do the aspiration but she went and found somebody else to do it.)
If any of the doctors question me this time I will have a line to hand back to them thanks to the post where the lady said...let a man have scrotum problems and it would get healed right away. It will be funny to see their face.
I have already asked my primary care doctor to refer me TODAY and hope to have the mammogram next week. I don't care if they think I am a sissy

AgeInfo.Phrase: <Z> <Z> <Z> I am 59 and not on hormones but

Posts.Title: Post-menopausal cysts

Posts.Content:
Hi, I had a radial scar removed July 2012 and was surprised at the lack of information on the Internet. Post Op I felt fine and had the usual discomfort but it has lasted, it's now been almost 11 months. The discomfort is not daily but comes and goes and so does my mind worrying about
 what might happen one day. I can not find anywhere any information about
 realistic pain discomfort or follow-up. My surgeon (who is one of the best in Australia) told me that seeing that there is no specific risk factors that I don't need to worry about
 a check up for 2 years. I was told that too many mammograms might be harmful to the breast bone in the long rum. Anyone have an opinion or experience. Much appreciated!
Posts.Title: Radial scar.... anyone else have?

Posts.Content:
Hi Merrida
Thanks for taking time to answer me. I know! The dr that told me I'm paranoid are in her 50's, so she should know better.
Thanks
Cindy
Posts.Title: Pain two years after radial scar removal

Posts.Content:
Hi, I had a radial scar removed (benign) two years ago. The first six months no pain, then my ribs started hurting, I now have daily pain. The scar tissue is hard and painful. Sometimes I have a deep aching pain in my breast and sometimes a specific pain. At the moment my shoulders pains on and off. I've been to three doctors the last 18 months, all three told me patients and recovery differs and the last one told me I'm paranoid of getting BC. I struggling to find any info online in regards to radial scars and recovery after biopsy.
If anyone had a similar experience I would love to know.
Thanks
Cindy
Posts.Title: Pain two years after radial scar removal

Posts.Content: I'm new and don't know what these silly icons mean. Long ago- 1999 i was dx with micro calsand did nothing but read what I could. Two years later I had Stage II BC. Do not wait 6 months. Find a BC surgeon who is a woman and act fast
Posts.Title: Microcalcifications-should I wait for a biopsy?

Posts.Content:
Hi,I'm new to talking on line but need help. I'm an eight year survivor- 9/11/01 was my dx date. In 2005 I was dxed with Mets to the bone and in 2007 with mets to the liver." TN Mountain Girl talked about
 liver pain and I want to ask her about
 it. My bone pain is intense and I'm using a cane. Pallative nurses have begun coming to my home to administer pain meds and help me. Will someone talk about
 the pain they have? My mets is to my T-Spine pelvis and ribs. I'm here to help anyone with questios too
